text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen right 
now in vancouver it is so nice and warm it feels

almost like thailand so i thought i would show 
you a recipe that is perfect for this weather i'm

making mango coconut jelly cubes and in Thai that 
is woon mamuang want now one is agar agar which is
what we're going to use to set our jelly and mamuang is mango it's the perfect summer dessert it's

delicious it's fresh it's fruity and it's super 
super easy to make let's get started so let's

first make the mango base okay so I am using this 
kind of mango you can use whatever mango you have

even frozen will work really well for this the 
only condition is that has to be ripe and sweet

okay otherwise it just won't taste very good I 
also like mangoes that are not very fibrous so

this one is great make sure you peel the skin far 
enough because if you peel the skin too thin you

taste a little bit of bitterness sometimes and 
I'm just going to blend this up in that goes and

to help it blend I'm going to add some orange 
juice the acidity and the citrusy quality will

accent and brighten up the sweetness of the mango 
as well it's my own little trick off the goes

hmm now you want to make sure this is very fine no 
lumps no chunks no nothing okay so good let's talk

about wooden or agar-agar now agar-agar I don't 
know why it's a double word but that's just the

way it is you can think of it kind of like a 
gelatin it sets liquid however unlike gelatin

this is plant-based so if you've got vegetarian 
friends coming over and they don't eat gelatin you

can definitely feed them this it comes in a packet 
like this sometimes the packet doesn't look like

this it's okay you can use whatever brand you 
want it really doesn't matter they're all the

same the most important thing about this is you 
want to add it when the water is cold give it a

stir and then bring it to a boil if you add this 
after the water has already boiled it'll clump up

really quickly and then it'll be impossible to 
get it all separated now you want to bring it

to a full boil because that's when they're going 
to all dissolve and keep stirring it every once

in a while because if you don't they'll settle 
to the bottom and then you feel this gel layer

forming at the bottom of your pot all right so 
it's come to a full boil and so the way to test

to see whether it has completely dissolved is to 
take a little spoon or a big spoon and pour it

off and if you don't see tiny little grain sort 
of clinging on to the spoon then you are good to

go turn the heat back on so now I'm going to add 
some sugar now you may need more or less sugar

than me that completely depends on the sweetness 
of your mango and your orange juice so at the

end you're going to taste and adjust from there 
bring it back to a boil one more time make sure

that the sugar is completely dissolved and then go 
in with the mango because before this boils over

and whisk it to break up a little lumps I tried 
using us a wooden spoon and the little lumps just

keep swimming around the pots drove me crazy and 
that's it that is the base of the mango jelly how

easy is that because we're working with natural 
ingredients so important that you taste this

ooh and that's just good on its own already mmm 
now at this point you can add more sugar if you

think it's not sweet enough but you can also add 
a little more acid if this is too one-dimensional

esuite it won't be very refreshing and if your 
mangos really sweet but not a lot of sour add

a little more lime juice I'm just going to do a 
quick squeeze not too much because I've got some

orange juice in there and it just needs a little 
lift so I've got a square pan here now you can

do this in individual little shot glasses you can 
do this in animal mold you can do what edges you

know like jello you can put it in whatever mold 
you like okay and I'm just going to pour this in

bubbles you want to get rid of these bubbles so if 
your mixture is starting to cool and it's starting

to thicken the bubbles will become really hard to 
pop so you can just spoon them out all together

okay that's good enough I am going to add more 
mango goodness so I've got some mango flesh here

you don't have to add mango I've actually done 
this with Michi oh my god that was really good

as well now wouldn't set at room temperature it's 
so awesome you don't have to wait for hours like

jello for it to set however it also means that you 
have to work quite quickly especially if you are

doing small ones because it will solidify quick 
now if it solidifies on you and you need to remelt

it you need to bring it to a boil again find a 
little trick I like to sometimes add mint leaves

to this just to add you know a little freshness 
kind of like mojito woo on the subject of mojito

if you want to add some alcohol you certainly 
can it'll be like the vegan jello shot you can

certainly stop here and serve it just acid is 
mango and mint super delicious and refreshing

but sometimes I like to add a layer of coconut 
jelly to it because it adds a beautiful color

contrast it also adds a little bit of a creaminess 
it adds an air of tropical you know memory to

it out coconut and mango goes really really 
well together all right let's get that later

so it's the same thing all over again except with 
coconut milk instead of mango puree got some cold

water give it a stir come to a boil some sugar a 
little bit of salt going with some coconut milk

so the mango layer is mostly set and by mostly 
said I meant the surface you shake it and it's

not moving good to go make sure you keep your 
coconut layer warm because if it sits and you

forget about it you forget about everything 
this is going to be solidified then you have

to heat it back up to melt it down again you 
want to be gentle don't just pour everything

down I like to pour it over a spoon and if you 
see the tiny little pieces that's just the thin

pieces that has set you know around the side 
of the pot or on the skin on the surface don't

worry about it that really won't show at all now 
this will set very very quickly because this is

a thin layer but don't be tempted to eat it 
let it cool down because trust me wooden is

not good at room temperature it has to have to 
be cold so control yourself for the next few

hours while this chills so I suggest that 
the best way to enjoy this cool refreshing

dessert is to be out in the patio on the porch 
somewhere in the Sun if possible and here we go
hmm

mmm there's so refreshing it's tender it's 
not like jello it's not bouncy it's got a

firmer feel to it but it's still super 
refreshing in that mango flavor really

accented by the orange citrusy flavor 
oh my god it is just so good and in this

beautiful weather just perfect so I hope 
you give this a try recipe as oasis on

hot eye-catching calm and please send a photo 
if you make this it's so beautiful and I will

see you next time for your next delicious 
Thai meal it goes what's your only catch
